page.title: 20LEGEND OF BISHOP AUCKLAND-3
page.content: "By St.Cuthbert!", said the Bishop, laughing, "You have outwitted me as you did the boar. If I am to keep my promise I must give you my own castle. come!" The Bishop took Pollard outside to a small hill and showed him the land surrounding it. He then said,"I will give you all this land in exchange for my castle. Will you take it?" Pollard said he would and the Bishop gave it to him and his family for ever. Since that day, the land on which Bishop Auckland is built has been known as Pollard's Lands, and there is in Etherley Lane, near to St.Anne's School, a public House named "The Pollard".
